org.apache.lenya.cms.metadata
Class CustomMetaData

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.avalon.framework.logger.AbstractLogEnabled
      org.apache.lenya.cms.metadata.MetaDataImpl
          org.apache.lenya.cms.metadata.CustomMetaData
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.avalon.framework.logger.LogEnabled, MetaData
public class CustomMetaData
extends MetaDataImpl

Custom meta-data is arbitrary meta-data that can be associated to a document or a resource. The following code illustrates how you would add custom metadata to a document: 

 
    MetaData customMetaData = document.getMetaDataManager().getCustomMetaData();
    customMetaData.setValue("some-great-attribute", "some great value");
    customMetaData.setValue("another-great-attribute", "some fantastic value");
    customMetaData.save();

Version:
$Id: CustomMetaData.java 230447 2005-08-05 11:48:56Z andreas $

useFixedElements

protected boolean useFixedElements()
Description copied from class: MetaDataImpl
Determine if the meta-data should consist of a fixed list of known attributes, or whether arbitrary names can be used.

Overrides:
useFixedElements in class MetaDataImpl
Returns:
true if meta-data consists of fixed elements

getElements

protected java.lang.String[] getElements()
Description copied from class: MetaDataImpl
Elements to be used in this meta-data. A meta-data implementation which does not have a fixed list of elements may return an empty array, and override useFixedElements()

Specified by:
getElements in class MetaDataImpl
Returns:
an array of string representing the elements

getTerms

protected java.lang.String[] getTerms()
Description copied from class: MetaDataImpl
Terms to be used in this meta-data. A meta-data implementation requiring only one namespace may ignore terms and return an empty array.
